districts.summary: Rotaract District 3770, a vital segment of Rotary International, serves the eastern and northern regions of Luzon in the Philippines.

Discover the vibrant community of Rotaract clubs in this district, where young professionals develop leadership skills and implement innovative service projects addressing local needs. Join us in making a positive impact through fellowship, professional development, and community service.
RID 3790 is sometimes referred to as the "hospitable district" since everyone there extends a warm welcome to visitors and Rotaract family members.
Rotaract Clubs of RID 3800, also known for its namesake as The Resilient District, is in Metropolitan Manila, Philippines.
District 3810 stands as a beacon of innovation, collaboration, and service, fostering leaders and initiatives that inspire change across the Asia-Pacific and beyond.
Rotaract District 3820, widely recognized as the “Fellowship Capital of the Philippine Rotaract,” is one of the largest and most dynamic Rotaract districts in the country.

Through unity, passion, and unwavering commitment, the district aims to create transformative change in the lives of communities it serves, while continually upholding its motto. Distrito Trentay Otso Trenta, Sama-Sama, Nagkakaisa

District 3850 is home of young, vibrant, and active Rotaractors and Interactors. As the district where the first Rotaract Club was chartered, District 3850 continues to imbibe the organization’s motto “Fellowship Through Service” and commits themselves to innovative ways of learning, giving, and educating the community towards progress.
Rotary International District 3860 is hailed as the most festive and culturally rich district in the Philippines. Encompassing Regions 7, 8, 11, 12, and 13, it spans a diverse and dynamic territory.

Discover the vibrant community of Rotaract clubs in this district, where young professionals develop leadership skills and implement innovative service projects addressing local needs. Join us in making a positive impact through fellowship, professional development, and community service.

featuredEvents.title: 14TH PILIPINAS ROTARACT CONVENTION
featuredEvents.description:
PROCON 2026: WE BEAT WITH YOU!

The Pilipinas Rotaract Convention (PROCON) 2026 is the biggest annual gathering of Rotaractors from all 10 districts across the Philippines. Happening on February 20–22, 2026, this year’s convention heads to the vibrant City of Love — Iloilo City!

With the theme "WE BEAT WITH YOU," PROCON 2026 celebrates the heart and rhythm of service, leadership, and unity. Inspired by the spirit of Iloilo, the event highlights "From Festive Streets to Flavor Feasts," promising a colorful fusion of learning, culture, and fellowship. Get ready to experience dynamic sessions, lively festivities, and a taste of Iloilo’s rich traditions as we come together to beat as one.

procon.title: 14th Pilipinas Rotaract Convention
procon.description:
PROCON 2026: WE BEAT WITH YOU! 

February 20-22, 2026
ILOILO CITY, PHILIPPINES | HOSTED BY ROTARY INTERNATIONAL DISTRICT 3850

procon.title: 10th Pilipinas Rotaract Convention
procon.description:
City of Majestic Waterfalls, Iligan City | Hosted by Rotary International District 3870

The PROCON 2022, being the first PROCON in Mindanao and the first to be hosted face-to-face in a pandemic-stricken Philippines, was definitely a half-week to remember. Despite all the restrictions, the delegates got to enjoy the city, the company of their fellow Rotaractors and the true spirit of Rotaract, which is “Fellowship Through Service”. The annual event is a perfect venue to embrace the diversity of the Pilipinas Rotaract, while celebrating oneness of goals, service and achievements. This is definitely a great way to celebrate the Rotary year!

objectiveDetails: Learn more about this event at the event page.

rotaractStatisticsCards.title: Rotaractors Around the World as of April 2025
rotaractStatisticsCards.description: Rotaract has become a global movement with over 133,885 members in more than 9,397 clubs across 180 countries. Rotaract members are making significant impacts in their communities through service projects, leadership development, and international cooperation initiatives.

rotaractStatisticsCards.title: Rotaract Clubs in the Philippines as of April 2025
rotaractStatisticsCards.description: The Philippines is home to 608 Rotaract clubs distributed across 10 districts. The strong Rotaract presence in the country reflects the commitment of young Filipino professionals and students to service, leadership, and community development through the Rotary network.

rotaractStatisticsCards.title: Rotaract Members in the Philippines as of April 2025
rotaractStatisticsCards.description: With 8,094 active members, Philippine Rotaract represents one of the largest and most active Rotaract communities globally. These young leaders are engaged in numerous service projects, professional development initiatives, and cross-district collaborations through the MDIO framework.

rotaractStatisticsCharts.title: PH Rotaract Contributions (Per district in USD)

leadershipChair.name: PDRR John Philip S. Chan
leadershipChair.title: Chairperson, Pilipinas Rotaract Multi-District Information Organization
leadershipChair.description: Leading with dedication and innovation, our Chair works tirelessly to strengthen Rotaract's presence and impact across the Philippines, fostering collaboration between districts and empowering the next generation of leaders.
leadershipChair.club: Rotaract Club of Taguig, Rotary International District 3830

actions.title: Chairperson, Pilipinas Rotaract Multi-District Information Organization (MDIO) Rotary Year 2025–2026
actions.description:
PDRR John Philip Chan has already become a name synonymous with servant leadership, purpose-driven impact, and unwavering dedication to the ideals of Rotaract. With a heart for public service and a mind sharpened by experience, John stands today as the Chairperson of the Pilipinas Rotaract Multi-District Information Organization—leading the nation’s premier platform for collaboration and innovation among Rotaract clubs in the Philippines.

A proud graduate of Lyceum of the Philippines University – Manila with a degree in Foreign Service, Major in Diplomacy, John continues to pursue excellence through graduate studies in Public Management at the University of the Philippines – Open University. His academic journey is marked not only by scholarly pursuits but by a commitment to make governance work for the people.

His leadership extends far beyond the classroom. John has served at the heart of Philippine policymaking—as Deputy Party List Manager under Congresswoman Marissa “Del Mar” Magsino and as a Political Affairs Officer under the distinguished Senator Richard J. Gordon. Recognized early on for his leadership potential, he was awarded the Gerry Roxas Leadership Award—a reflection of the impact he continues to make.

But it is in Rotaract where John’s passion truly found its purpose.

From his beginnings as President of the Rotaract Club of South Signal Village, he quickly rose as a transformational leader. Under his guidance, the club garnered multiple awards across all avenues of service, including gold, silver, and bronze distinctions for its impactful programs. His excellence in leadership earned him the rare honor of being appointed District Secretary of Rotaract District 3830 for two consecutive terms—proof of his consistency, credibility, and character.

In 2017, John made history. Not only was he elected as President of the LPU English Club—the university’s largest student organization—but he also became the first elected District Rotaract Representative-Nominee and, later, the youngest District Rotaract Representative of RI District 3830. At just 22, he led 71 clubs across Metro Manila and Palawan, setting a new standard for youth-led governance in Rotary.

After his trailblazing term, he co-founded the Rotaract Club of Taguig—the first in his district and one of only two in the country without a sponsoring Rotary club. This bold and barrier-breaking move united seasoned leaders from four different clubs, proving that collaboration—not structure—creates impact.

John’s journey in Pilipinas Rotaract MDIO is equally inspiring. From a Learning and Development Associate to Deputy Chief for Policy and Process Improvement, to a two-term Treasurer—and now, Chairperson—he has embodied the MDIO’s mission to connect, empower, and elevate Filipino Rotaractors. Under his leadership, the MDIO continues to champion excellence, innovation, and unity across all districts nationwide.

More than his titles, it is John’s humility, vision, and authenticity that define him. He reminds us that age is not a limitation, that service is not about status, and that leadership is not about being in front—but being for others.

John Philip Chan is not just a leader of today—he is a catalyst for tomorrow, and a living example of what’s possible when passion meets purpose in the spirit of “Service Above Self.”

introduction.title: Supporting The Rotary Foundation's Global Impact
introduction.content: The Rotary Foundation transforms your gifts into service projects that change lives both close to home and around the world. Since 1917, the Foundation has spent more than $4 billion on life-changing, sustainable projects that help people in need with access to safe water, medical care, literacy, education, and other critical needs. By giving to the Foundation, you become an essential part of these ongoing efforts to create lasting positive change in communities everywhere.

funds.title: Annual Fund
funds.description: The Annual Fund is the primary source of funding for Foundation activities. Your contributions to the Annual Fund help Rotary clubs take action to create positive change in communities at home and around the world. Through grants and projects, Rotary members combat diseases like polio and malaria, provide clean water, improve economic opportunities, and promote peace.

funds.title: PolioPlus Fund
funds.description: Rotary has been working to eradicate polio for more than 35 years. Our goal of ridding the world of this disease is closer than ever. When you contribute to the PolioPlus Fund, you're supporting Rotary's top priority - ensuring that polio is eradicated and that it never returns. Your donation helps deliver vaccinations, transportation, and educational materials.

funds.title: Endowment Fund
funds.description: The Endowment Fund ensures the long-term financial stability of the Foundation and provides essential support for Rotary's programs. Contributions to the Endowment Fund are invested in perpetuity, with a portion of the fund's earnings spent on Foundation programs each year. This provides a steady and reliable source of income to meet the world's greatest needs.

funds.title: Disaster Response Fund
funds.description: The Rotary Disaster Response Fund provides a ready mechanism for Rotary districts to respond quickly to local disasters. Districts in affected areas may receive disaster response grants to provide basic items such as water, food, medicine, and clothing. Your support enables our communities to recover more quickly after devastating natural disasters.
